intro: Tarenna pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered tarenna, is a tropical climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Tarenna pauciflora is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant diversity in the region.
